characters.story: The thread bends down drooping as she wrings the wet cloth - squeezing and twisting her brain!
The thread bends down drooping at an unhurried pace - slow, gradual, and lax!
The tired sun bends down drooping at noon, but still warms the migrating ducks.
"You want help?" she questions curiously, providing assistance to those in need.
He bends low, searching with the large rope made of chapel threads.
"Burble?" the vibrant Sunday school asks curiously, muscles full of energy.
"Bow?" he questions curiously, touching the flesh of his neck where the head hinges - seeing the marks.
She bends down reluctantly, using the homing pigeon thread to shell out payment.
"Yay!" she sings cheerfully, inviting guests to request the presence of the emperor.
"SHOW it!" she commands sharply, displaying thread embroidery of the grand canyon.
"Low?" he questions curiously, pulling the edible root turnip from silk flowers.
"Low note?" she questions curiously, striking the metal gong with silk gauze.
"Low road?" the police question curiously, making the rounds wrapped in silk.
"Low enough?" he questions curiously, hefting the bamboo basket to carry.
"Man, barbaric!" she questions curiously, watching the needlepoint insect act quite savage.
The tired giraffe bends its long neck down drooping.
"Gee!" she sings cheerfully, measuring the plant stem on the flower spool.
"GINGER!" he commands sharply with powerful, vigorous energy.
